parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To leap up (for joy). From ek and hallomai; to spring forth.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To leap, leap up; of water: To spring up, bubble up.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To praise. From ainos; to praise.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
